content.description: Start on a very thing crimp for the right and a roundish nubbin for the left. Go straight up to some hidden crimps. Hard foot moves.

Classic V0. This and El Classico are two of the best. For those who are at the grade, its a great climb to work. For those above the grade, its over too quickly. Can we normalize people being able to project a V0?Stand start on edges and go straight up finishing through the massive sloper rail (crux).
content.location: Look for the massive sloper rail above head height at one end of the corridor.

content.description: Find the large shelf at the opposite end of the corridor from Goforia and head up trending right to gain the big bomber edge. More fun for shorties because you almost have to jump. Super easy for even not so tall people. Book says V3 but I wonder if this and the climb to the left had their grades switched. Felt V0 to me. That being said, a super fun climb.
content.location: Near the end of the Goforia.

content.description: A wild slab, I'm sure. Start with a left hand on a tiny mono edge, and make hard moves directly up the slab. There is actually a video on youtube, thankfully.There are a couple holds that resemble the starting hold. This climb is the nearest to Goforia compared to all the other slabs.
content.location: There are a couple holds that resemble the starting hold. This climb is the nearest to Goforia compared to all the other slabs.

content.description: A fantastic spot if V0 is your grade, or to just have fun. Can't believe this wasn't added til now. Home of the classic V0 Goforia and some neat slabs. A nice long hallway.
